subject: Re: [junit] Installing junit3.8.1 question
msgSnippet: ... Please do not take this the wrong way. This may seem harsh, and that s not my intention. There is no manual for installing JUnit, because it would have
messageBody:
Stephen Liu wrote:

> Hi Ray,
>
> Tks for your advice.
>
> I failed to locate the manual for installing junit
> 3.8.1 on Linux

Please do not take this the wrong way. This may seem harsh, and that's
not my intention.

There is no manual for installing JUnit, because it would have only one
line:

1. Add junit.jar to your classpath.

The assumption is that the reader already knows how to put a .jar file
on the classpath, since that's beginner Java information.

That's why there is no manual.

Best of luck.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
